content: Which iconic American singer, known as the "King of Rock and Roll", released a self-titled debut album in 1956 featuring hits like "Blue Suede Shoes"?

That would be Elvis Presley. His debut album, released on RCA Victor in March 1956, was titled simply "Elvis Presley." It included his version of "Blue Suede Shoes," which was originally recorded by Carl Perkins. Elvis's rendition became one of his early hits and helped establish him as a major force in the music industry. His unique blend of country, blues, and rhythm and blues styles played a significant role in the development of rock and roll music.
